DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Other Anticonvulsant Agent Administered Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to the concomitant medication of other that previously mentioned anticonvulsants (drugs that prevent, reduce, or stop convulsions or seizures) being administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Other Anticonvulsant Agent Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the concomitant medication of other that previously mentioned anticonvulsants (drugs that prevent, reduce, or stop convulsions or seizures) being administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:(an-tee-kon-VUL-sants) Drugs that prevent, reduce, or stop convulsions or seizures.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Medicine to stop, prevent, or control seizures (convulsions).
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update
